inclusion.criterion: Patients diagnosed with high risk recurrent or refractory solid tumors following initial chemotherapy
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Tumor must be sensitive to chemotherapy (maximum 8 cycles) and/or radiation defined as a greater than 50% reduction in size of the primary and/or metastatic sites.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Patients who are under 35 years of age.
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Patients with a life expectancy of at least 8 weeks and performance status (Karnofsky or Lansky score) of at least 70%.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Patients who are acceptable candidates for peripheral blood stem cell transplantation based on their pre-transplant evaluation.
inclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients with central nervous system tumors are not eligible for this protocol.
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patients have significant functional deficits in major organs which would interfere with successful outcome following PBSCT.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patients who have been treated for infections must have appropriate responses as documented by negative cultures and/or a normal radiographic examination.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients may not have active CNS disease or marrow involvement with the tumor at the time of transplant.
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patients with disease progression after tandem PBSC #1 will not be eligible for tandem PBSC #2.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patients who have had a previous stem cell transplant.
exclusion.label: met

notes: The patient is an obese woman with sleep apnea, PCO and dissatisfaction with her body shape. She has high cholesterol and triglycerides.
